titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Helen Winchester (Mrs. John E. Gapp) (d. 1955) was a scientific illustrator and researcher at the Academy of Natural Sciences from the early 1900s through at least 1946. Winchester created drawings for a number of curators at the Academy, most extensively for Henry Pilsbry, curator of the Malacology Department.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of eight ink illustrations and two watercolor illustrations of insects, primarily orthoptera, created by Helen Winchester.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia: Selwyn S. Roback papers (contains Winchester illustrations), Helen Winchester illustration (collection 394), and Pilsbry monograph, with Helen Winchester illustrations (collection 555).
